::Zardus::

"The creatures that Magmatron created were very good fighters," 
Zardus replies, "This is kind of an experiment."

His computer silently plays back the transmission from the Onyx, and 
Zardus silently replies, no sign on the outside that he was doing 
anything other than talking to Lady Hawk.

"Welcome to earth, Ambassador Mortem," the transmission reads, "From 
what my scanners report of your ship, my island is not big enough to 
house it. If you can land your ship nearby, I can hold audience with 
you. The defences won't fire as you approach."

"Yes, there'll be security," Zardus says to Lady Hawk after ending 
the transmission to Mortem. "If the bot is uncontrollable it'll have 
to be redone. Once you're successful, you'll be free to go."



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> Lady Hawk looked at the details from the project. In her travells 
she'd seen
> parasites like this. there were few good qualities to balance but 
she didn't
> have much of a choice. "I can do this alone if you wish but why 
would you
> want such horrible creatures? She remembered the planets where such
> creatures existed were virtually lifeless. (Wheres Sigourny Weaver 
when we
> need her?) The only thing that she could do was combine the 
alliance DNA and
> hope for a more controllable creature. "You will of course provide 
some
> security to watch the results." Lady Hawk was hesitant about the 
experiment
> but she knew that this was exactly the reason Veratis had taught 
her.
